Caption: Mr. S. Pasupathi receives the Siemens' prize from Sir C.V. Raman
Description: One of the recipients of the Siemens Prizes was Shri S. Pasupathy (M. Tech. in Electrical Engineering). He later went on to receive his M. Phil. & Ph. D. degrees in Engineering & Applied Science from Yale University in 1970 and 1972 respectively. The next year he joined the ECE Department at the university of Toronto and taught UG and PG courses for more than 35 years. He is also accredited to having served as Chairman of the Communication Group and Associate Chairman of ECE. He is a Fellow of the IEEE, Engineering Institute of Canada and Canadian Academy of Engineering. His passion for teaching was born when he was a Research student and a part time lecturer at IITM. He was the first Canadian Professor in the area of communication to be listed in the prestigious ‘highly cited researchers’  list of ISI  Web of Knowledge attesting to the widespread influence his research in the area of application of statistical communication and design of digital communication systems has had on both theory and practice. His personal interests include Tamil literature and poetry. Several of his articles and poems have been published in various magazines. He also received an Institue Merit Prize during the convocation ceremony.
